p: It was discovered that there was high amount of SA in S. suberosa (10.5 mg/g dry weight of crude extract), allowing us to hypothesize that the SA might be the primary defensive chemical produced by the gorgonian as a natural antifoulant. Meanwhile, the procedure required for the SA isolation was relatively easy with only simple extractions and one-time column chromatography (CC) purification needed. In view of the rich presence and relatively easy preparation of SA from S. suberosa, the potential of SA or its derivatives as novel antifoulants was attractive.
